Textforbot.Text: - Welcome! üëã MediSick - your personal assistant in the world of medicine I'm here to help you understand your symptoms and suggest possible diagnoses üìã ‚ÄºÔ∏è Remember, I'm not a substitute for a visit to the doctor ‚ÄºÔ∏è

MediSick is your personal assistant in the world of medicine, available to you at any time.
 Disease identification: The bot has a database containing information about various diseases and their associated symptoms. It analyzes the symptoms you enter to suggest possible diagnoses. 
 Medication search: The bot allows users to search for information about specific medications. Users can enter the name of the drug, and the bot will provide information about it.
 Area search: The bot determines your location and allows you to find pharmacies nearby, clinics nearby, and hospitals near you.
 
 For inquiries: https://github.com/DrgNBoN

To get a list to choose symptoms, select the relevant subcategories below and press 
‚úÖGet list‚úÖ

After you have received a list with symptoms and their numbers, send these numbers to the bot as a message:
For example: '12,87,10', '41 52 67 47', '86/19/73'

18 - Rapid or irregular heartbeat 19 - Visible veins on the legs 30 - Burning and itching in the vein area 73 - High blood pressure 79 - Low blood pressure 80 - Bluish lips and earlobes 105 - Rapid heartbeat

21 - Skin inflammation 29 - Jaundice (yellowing of the skin) 35 - Itching on the skin 41 - Skin rashes 42 - Red rashes with watery blisters 43 - Bleeding from formations on the skin 54 - Non-healing sores 57 - New pigmented spots or moles 62 - Skin swelling 68 - Skin peeling 69 - Foci of fungal infection 76 - Skin redness 77 - Facial redness 84 - Hair loss 102 - Skin hardening

7 - Lower abdominal pain 10 - Middle abdominal pain 13 - Pain and burning in the upper abdominal area 14 - Pain and itching in the anus 15 - Pain when swallowing 16 - Pain when chewing 22 - Gas and bloating 28 - Chewing pain 31 - Constipation 37 - Heartburn 44 - Bleeding after defecation 51 - Digestive disorders 67 - Belching 81 - Constant thirst 82 - Loss of appetite 83 - Weight loss 91 - Vomiting 99 - Nausea 100 - Abdominal enlargement 106 - Frequent liquid defecation
4 - Pain during menstruation 8 - Pain in the kidneys 17 - Pain during urination 45 - Blood in urine 48 - Menstrual irregularities 49 - Renal colic 98 - Dark urine 107 - Frequent urination

2 - Restlessness and anxiety 23 - Headache 24 - Dizziness 25 - Pressure in the ears 32 - Sleep difficulties 38 - Mood changes 47 - Manic episodes 53 - Inattention 56 - Inability to perform algorithms 71 - Paralysis 86 - Loss of consciousness 87 - Problems with movements 89 - Confusion and memory loss 92 - Speech disorders 96 - Reflex reduction 110 - Epileptic seizures or convulsions
33 - Difficulty breathing 39 - Cough 40 - Cough with sputum 52 - Runny nose 59 - Shortness of breath 108 - Sneezing
1 - Astigmatism 3 - Sparkle in the eyes 20 - Eye inflammation 63 - Eye swelling 74 - Eye redness 78 - Clouding of the lens 75 - Eye redness and tearing 104 - Worsening of vision

5 - Throat pain 12 - Ear pain 34 - Throat and nose itching 46 - Fever 60 - Chills 61 - Laryngeal swelling 64 - Throat swelling 66 - Mucous membrane swelling 72 - Elevated temperature 94 - Weakness 95 - Weakness on one side of the body 101 - Enlarged lymph nodes 103 - Fatigue

6 - Chest pain 9 - Lower back pain 11 - Joint pain 26 - Pressure or discomfort in the chest 50 - Muscle pain 55 - Abnormal crunching and squeaking in the joints 58 - Limited mobility 65 - Swelling and pain in the legs 70 - Feeling of heaviness and fatigue in the legs 90 - Delamination of the nail plate
27 - Attention deficit 36 - Excess weight 85 - Loss of interest in life 88 - Hearing problems 93 - Chest tightness 97 - Social isolation 109 - Episodes of depression
Based on the provided symptoms, the bot suggests you may have:
‚ùóÔ∏èAttention‚ùóÔ∏è The bot's prediction does not replace a visit to the doctor.

Viral infection that can cause respiratory problems, conjunctivitis, and other symptoms.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adenovirus_infection)

Inflammation of the nasal mucosa caused by an allergic reaction to various allergens.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allergic_rhinitis)

Disease characterized by inflammation of the tonsils and throat, usually caused by a bacterial infection.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angina_(sore_throat))

Swelling of the skin, mucous membranes, or subcutaneous tissue, usually caused by an allergic reaction.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angioedema)

Chronic inflammatory disease of the airways that can cause episodes of breathlessness and wheezing.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asthma)

Mental disorder characterized by periods of euphoria and depression.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bipolar_disorder)

Group of diseases that affect the joints and surrounding tissues.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_disease)

Dilation and venous insufficiency, most commonly in the lower extremities.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Varicose_veins)

Slow-acting viral disease characterized by outbreaks of blisters on the skin accompanied by itching.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herpes_zoster)

Inflammation of the eye's conjunctiva caused by a viral infection.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viral_conjunctivitis)

Inflammation of the mucous membrane of the stomach and intestines, usually caused by a virus or bacteria.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gastroenteritis)

A type of stroke that occurs when bleeding in the brain leads to a disruption of its functions.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hemorrhagic_stroke)

Inflammation and enlargement of veins in the rectum and anus.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hemorrhoid)

Inflammation of the liver, usually caused by a virus.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hepatitis)

Liver cancer that develops from liver tissue cells.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hepatocellular_carcinoma)

A viral disease characterized by the appearance of blistering rashes on the skin or mucous membranes.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herpes)

A condition in which the thyroid gland produces too many hormones.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperthyroidism)

Chronic elevation of arterial blood pressure.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertension)

A condition in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough hormones.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypothyroidism)

A group of eye diseases that lead to increased intraocular pressure and damage to the optic nerve.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glaucoma)

Infections caused by fungi that affect the skin.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungal_skin_infection)

Urinary tract infections caused by fungi.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungal_urinary_tract_infection)

A disease caused by fungi that can affect various parts of the body.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungus)

A mental disorder characterized by a prolonged period of low mood and loss of interest in life.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_depressive_disorder)

Inflammation of the skin that can cause itching, redness, and irritation.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dermatitis)

Chronic disease in which the blood sugar level is elevated.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diabetes)

A condition where the frequency and fluidity of stools are increased.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diarrhea)

Imbalance of microorganisms in the intestine, which can lead to digestion problems.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dysbiosis)

Infectious disease that affects the mucous membranes of the throat and nose, causing difficulty breathing.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dysentery)

A group of diseases that affect the thyroid gland and its functions.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dysthyroidism)

Sleep disorder characterized by difficulties falling asleep or staying asleep.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insomnia)

Sudden disruption of blood circulation in the brain that can lead to loss of function.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ischemic_stroke)

Necrosis (death) of part of the heart muscle due to a disruption of blood supply.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myocardial_infarction)

Disease in which the urinary tract is affected by bacterial or viral infection.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urinary_tract_infection)

A condition where the arteries of the heart are narrowed or blocked, leading to a disruption of blood supply to the heart muscle.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronary_artery_disease)

Formation of hard deposits in the kidneys that can cause pain and problems with urination.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kidney_stone_disease)

Eye disease where the lens becomes cloudy, causing vision impairment.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cataract)

Highly infectious respiratory disease that causes bouts of coughing.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pertussis)

Inflammation of the conjunctiva of the eye, usually caused by infection or allergic reaction.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjunctivitis)

Insufficient blood supply to the heart muscle due to the narrowing or blocking of arteries.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronary_artery_disease)

Highly infectious viral disease characterized by skin rashes and respiratory infection symptoms.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Measles)

Viral disease that can cause skin rashes and complications in pregnant women.
 [Wikipedia Article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rubella)

Cancer of the hematopoietic system that affects the blood and bone marrow.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hematopoietic_and_lymphoid_tissue)

A disease caused by the Leptospira bacterium, which spreads through contact with infected animals.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leptospirosis)

Cancer of the lymphatic system that affects lymph nodes and other parts of the body.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lymphoma)

Cancer of the lymphatic system that affects lymph nodes and other parts of the body.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lymphoma)

A viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes that can cause high fever and other symptoms.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dengue_fever)

A parasitic disease transmitted by mosquitoes, causing fever and other symptoms.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaria)

Disease of the mammary glands that can lead to the formation of tumors or cysts.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mastopathy)

Severe headache, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Migraine)

Diseases caused by fungi that affect the skin, nails, and other parts of the body.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mycosis)

Inflammation of the nerves that can lead to pain, numbness, and muscle weakness.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuritis)

Inflammation of the kidneys that can lead to problems with kidney function.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nephritis)

Kidney damage that can be caused by various factors, including diseases and toxins.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nephropathy)

A medical condition characterized by an excess accumulation of fat in the body.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obesity)

Acute respiratory viral infections, such as the common cold and flu.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acute_respiratory_infection)

Joint disease characterized by cartilage damage and inflammation.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osteoarthritis)

Inflammation of the bone and bone marrow, usually caused by bacterial infection.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osteomyelitis)

Disease characterized by reduced bone density and increased risk of fractures.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osteoporosis)

Degenerative spinal disease that can lead to pain and impaired function.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osteochondrosis)

Inflammation of the pancreas that can cause abdominal pain and digestive disturbances.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pancreatitis)

Inflammatory ear disease that can be caused by various factors, manifesting as pain, discomfort, and hearing loss.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otitis)

Inflammation of the parotid gland that can lead to swelling and tenderness of the submandibular glands.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parotitis)

A condition in which liver function is reduced or absent.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hepatic_failure)

Inflammation of the kidneys and urinary tract, usually caused by bacterial infection.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyelonephritis)

Inflammation of the lungs, usually caused by infection.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pneumonia)

Viral disease that affects the spinal cord and can lead to paralysis.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polio)

Inflammation of the pleural sheets, with the deposition of fibrin on their surface (dry pleurisy) or the accumulation of exudate of various kinds in the pleural cavity (exudative pleurisy).
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pleurisy)

Respiratory disease characterized by nasal congestion, stuffy nose, and sore throat.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_cold)

Chronic inflammatory skin disease characterized by redness, scales, and itching.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psoriasis)

Malignant neoplasm that affects various organs and tissues.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cancer)

Inflammatory disease of connective tissue and joints.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rheumatism)

Chronic inflammatory disease affecting joints and other organs.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rheumatoid_arthritis)

Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, a disorder of attention and behavior.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attention_deficit_hyperactivity_disorder)

Severe infectious disease in which infection spreads throughout the body through the blood.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sepsis)

A condition where the heart cannot effectively contract and pump blood.
 [Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heart_failure)

Inflammation of the sinuses that can cause nasal congestion, pain, and pressure in the facial area.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%83%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%82)

Infectious disease caused by the Streptococcus bacterium, characterized by skin rashes and throat inflammation.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A1%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BB%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B0)

Infectious disease caused by the Salmonella bacterium, characterized by high fever and other symptoms.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A2%D0%B8%D1%84)

Parasitic disease caused by the Toxoplasma parasite, which can affect various organs.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A2%D0%BE%D0%BA%D1%81%D0%BE%D0%BF%D0%BB%D0%B0%D0%B7%D0%BC%D0%BE%D0%B7)

Infectious disease caused by the Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacterium, affecting the lungs and other organs.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A2%D1%83%D0%B1%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%BA%D1%83%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%B7)

Inflammation of the urethra, causing painful urination and other symptoms.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A3%D1%80%D0%B5%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B8%D1%82)

Acute infectious disease caused by the Vibrio cholerae bacterium, characterized by watery stools and dehydration.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A5%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B0)

Disease of the blood vessels of the brain, leading to stroke and other disruptions of cerebral circulation.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A6%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%B1%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B0%D1%81%D0%BA%D1%83%D0%BB%D1%8F%D1%80%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D0%B1%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%B7%D0%BD%D1%8C)

Chronic liver disease characterized by the replacement of healthy liver tissue with scar tissue.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A6%D0%B8%D1%80%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B7_%D0%BF%D0%B5%D1%87%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8)

Inflammation of the bladder, causing painful and frequent urination.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A6%D0%B8%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%82)

Psychiatric disorder affecting thinking, perception, and behavior.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B8%D0%B7%D0%BE%D1%84%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8F)

Inflammatory skin disease characterized by itching, redness, and rashes.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AD%D0%BA%D0%B7%D0%B5%D0%BC%D0%B0)

Condition in which tissue similar to the inner lining of the uterus grows outside the uterus, causing painful periods and pelvic pain.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AD%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BE%D0%B7)

Inflammation of the brain, leading to headaches, fever, and nervous system disorders.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AD%D0%BD%D1%86%D0%B5%D1%84%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%82)

Neurological disorder causing recurrent epileptic seizures.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AD%D0%BF%D0%B8%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%BF%D1%81%D0%B8%D1%8F)

Parasitic disease caused by tapeworms, which can affect the liver and other organs.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AD%D1%85%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BA%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%B7)

Destruction of the stomach or duodenal mucosa, causing pain and discomfort in the gastrointestinal tract.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AF%D0%B7%D0%B2%D0%B0_%D0%B6%D0%B5%D0%BB%D1%83%D0%B4%D0%BA%D0%B0_%D0%B8_%D0%B4%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%B4%D1%86%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%B8%D0%BF%D0%B5%D1%80%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B9_%D0%BA%D0%B8%D1%88%D0%BA%D0%B8)

Chronic inflammatory bowel disease characterized by ulcers and ulcerative bleeding in the colon lining.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AF%D0%B7%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9_%D0%BA%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%82)

Helminthiasis from the group of nematodoses caused by Abbreviata caucasica.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%90%D0%B1%D0%B1%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%B7)

Group of diseases affecting humans and animals, caused by insects.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%AD%D0%BD%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BE%D0%B7%D1%8B)

Disruption of the conduction of an electrical impulse through the heart's conduction system.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%91%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BA%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%B0_%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B4%D1%86%D0%B0)

Agranulocytosis is a pathological condition characterized by a decrease in the level of leukocytes.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%90%D0%B3%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%83%D0%BB%D0%BE%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%B7)

In general, it is a curvature of the spine in the sagittal plane.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%9A%D0%B8%D1%84%D0%BE%D0%B7)

Rare congenital disease manifested by massive growth of blood vessels (vascular malformations) with replacement and destruction of bone tissue.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%91%D0%BE%D0%BB%D0%B5%D0%B7%D0%BD%D1%8C_%D0%93%D0%BE%D1%80%D1%85%D0%B5%D0%BC%D0%B0)

One of the main manifestations of vegetative dysfunction, the so-called 'heart pains,' feeling of pressure, compression, paresthesia, etc.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%9A%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B4%D0%B8%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B3%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D1%81%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B4%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%BC)

Zoonotic nematode infestation from the group of nematodoses, characterized by damage to the gastrointestinal tract.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%90%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B7%D0%B0%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B4%D0%BE%D0%B7)

Inflammation of pathologically hypertrophied (hyperplastic, hypertrophic) palatine (nasopharyngeal) tonsil (adenoids).
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%90%D0%B4%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B8%D0%B4%D1%8B)

Ascites is the accumulation of free fluid in the abdominal cavity.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%90%D1%81%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%82)

Inflammation of the bulb of the duodenum.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%91%D1%83%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%B1%D0%B8%D1%82)

A large group of various eye diseases accompanied by chronic inflammation of the eyelid margins and difficult treatment.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%91%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%84%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B8%D1%82)

Painful condition that occurs with insufficient intake of vitamins into the body compared to their expenditure.
[Wikipedia article](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%93%D0%B8%D0%BF%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B7)

Developmental anomaly characterized by the elongation of the entire colon or one of its sections (often the sigmoid colon) without thickening. 
[Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolichocolon)

Inflammation of the aortic wall of infectious or allergic (autoimmune) nature. 
[Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aortitis)

Blood fills the joint cavity and its convolutions, causing pain, increased joint volume, limited and painful movements, swelling, and swelling at the site of injury. 
[Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hemarthrosis)
